pr_title: Allow to extend how caching JDBC client is created

timeline.message: Allow to extend how caching JDBC client is created

timeline.bodyText:
Where does 1d come from?
sounds like "almost infinity"
use io.prestosql.plugin.jdbc.BaseJdbcConfig#getMetadataCacheTtl here
timeline.author: findepi

replies.bodyText:
sounds like "almost infinity"

That makes sense within single transaction. The value was moved from previous code version (see JdbcMetadataFactory)
replies.author: sopel39

replies.bodyText:
1d is neither "reasonably short for something" not "infinite"
I am OK not changing this, but maybe "TODO use infinity for in-transaction cache"
replies.author: findepi

replies.bodyText:
I am OK not changing this, but maybe "TODO use infinity for in-transaction cache"

I don't think planner will ask for stats after one day ;)
replies.author: sopel39
findepi

timeline.bodyText:
Does it mean CachingJdbcClient is no longer @Inject-ed and https://github.com/prestosql/presto/blob/142c8e20fb14535064667f8a7978525aa6e1f6f5/presto-base-jdbc/src/main/java/io/prestosql/plugin/jdbc/CachingJdbcClient.java#L62-L66 ctor should be removed?
or (likely), this is only for per-trnasaction cache?
then what about other cache?
timeline.author: findepi

+package io.prestosql.plugin.jdbc;
+
+import io.airlift.units.Duration;
+
+import javax.inject.Inject;
+
+import java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit;
+
+import static java.util.Objects.requireNonNull;
+
+public class DefaultCachingJdbcClientFactory
+        implements CachingJdbcClientFactory
+{
+    private final JdbcClient jdbcClient;
+
+    @Inject

replies.bodyText:
CachingJdbcClient is still created by Guava. There are two caches:

per-transaction cache
global cache (created by Guava) that is cross transactions.

This is similar mechanism to what we have in Hive
replies.author: sopel39

timeline.bodyText: Why do you stress it is caching related. I guess it should be generic and should be named JdbcClientFactory.

replies.bodyText:
"Default...." indicates this is the default impl
"Transactional..." indicates the role -- it's suitable within interface name (which is used for managing Guice binds)
replies.author: findepi

replies.bodyText:
Should JdbcClient become closeable?

You shouldn't close delegate JdbcClient, which is shared
replies.author: sopel39
